newsitem.title: USA: U.S. exporters report wheat sold to Pakistan--USDA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. exporters report wheat sold to Pakistan--USDA.

text.p: U.S. Agriculture Department said Monday private exporters reported sales of 150,000 tonnes of white wheat to Pakistan for delivery during the 1997/98 marketing year.
The marketing year for wheat began June 1.
Exporters must report to USDA sales of 100,000 tonnes or more of one commodity made in one day to a single destination by 1500 ET the next business day after the sale.
Sales of lesser quantities must be reported weekly.
